page.title: 07COMMUNITY CO-OPERATIVE.
page.content: Kilchrenan Community Co-operative was the first community co-perative to be formed on the mainland of Scotland. When the local shop was in danger of closing down the villagers decided that they would not like this to happen and so they raised the necessary capital by purchasing shares and with help from the H.I.D.B. the co-perative was formed and the premises were bought. It now consists of a shop, post office, public bar, petrol filling station and a tearoom. It is run by a full time manager who is responsible to the management committee of shareholders and employs one full time and 5 part time people. The shop tries to cater for everyday needs as the nearest town is 19 miles away, and the bar and tearoom tries to cater for the holiday trade of the area as well as the villagers.
